item.title: IP T1 Line Service
item.description: T1 lines have been around for a long time, initially used by phone companies to carry multiple calls between their facilities. Eventually, businesses adopted them for their phone systems. When the Internet became widespread, T1 lines were adapted to serve as dedicated internet connections. This might seem odd given their history, but in today’s internet-centric world, T1 lines can indeed function as IP connections. ](http://www.ethernetovercopper.co/) While T1 technology was originally designed for voice calls, the fundamental principle is that digital data is just a series of ones and zeros.

item.title: The Many Flavors of Ethernet Transport
item.description: Ethernet is becoming increasingly popular for Metropolitan Area Network (MAN) and Wide Area Network (WAN) transport. This surge in popularity is driven by IT and telecommunications managers seeking the highest data speeds at the most affordable prices, as well as the simplified management that Ethernet offers. By using Ethernet, multiple locations can be unified into a single, large network. Ideally, businesses would benefit from a direct fiber optic connection from a competitive carrier’s Point of Presence (POP) directly to their premises.
